dcterms:creator: David Danks
dcterms:description: The work discusses cognitive representations as graphical models, emphasizing the unification of cognitive science and graphical modeling.

dcterms:creator: Brenden M. Lake
Tomer D. Ullman
Joshua B. Tenenbaum
Samuel J. Gershman
dcterms:description: This paper explores how machines can learn and think like humans, focusing on cognitive models and learning processes.

dcterms:creator: Judea Pearl
Dana Mackenzie
dcterms:description: The book discusses the new science of cause and effect, providing insights into causal reasoning and its implications.

dcterms:creator: Peter Spirtes
Clark N. Glymour
Richard Scheines
dcterms:description: This work focuses on causation, prediction, and search, providing a framework for understanding causal relationships.

dcterms:creator: Richard S. Sutton
Andrew G. Barto
dcterms:description: This book serves as an introduction to reinforcement learning, covering fundamental concepts and algorithms.

dcterms:creator: Christopher JCH Watkins
Peter Dayan
dcterms:description: This paper introduces Q-learning, a model-free reinforcement learning algorithm that enables agents to learn optimal actions.
